meanings.definition: Prepare (written material) for publication by correcting, condensing, or otherwise modifying it.
meanings.sent1: She subedited the article to fix any mistakes before it was published.
meanings.sent2: The editor subedited the manuscript to ensure it was ready for printing.
meanings.sent3: The writer joked that she subedited her own work so much, it felt like a different story.
meanings.sent4: His revisions subedited the original text into a masterpiece of clarity and precision.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's guidance on how to subedit effectively made a lasting impact on the students.

meanings.sent1: After writing the article, she subedited it to make sure it was error-free.
meanings.sent2: The publishing house subedited the novel to prepare it for release.
meanings.sent3: The author subedited his own book, but the final version still had typos.
meanings.sent4: Her keen eye for detail allowed her to subedit the document quickly and accurately.
meanings.sent5: The team worked together to subedit the report, ensuring it met the company's standards.
